1.text: “I made a covenant with my eyes, how then should I look lustfully at a young woman?

2.text: For what is the portion from God above, and the heritage from the Almighty on high?

3.text: Is it not calamity to the unrighteous, and disaster to the workers of iniquity?

4.text: Doesn’t he see my ways, and number all my steps?

5.text: “If I have walked with falsehood, and my foot has hurried to deceit

6.text: (let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know my integrity);

7.text: if my step has turned out of the way, if my heart walked after my eyes, if any defilement has stuck to my hands,

8.text: then let me sow, and let another eat. Yes, let the produce of my field be rooted out.

9.text: “If my heart has been enticed to a woman, and I have laid wait at my neighbor’s door,

10.text: then let my wife grind for another, and let others sleep with her.

11.text: For that would be a heinous crime. Yes, it would be an iniquity to be punished by the judges:

12.text: For it is a fire that consumes to destruction, and would root out all my increase.

13.text: “If I have despised the cause of my male servant or of my female servant, when they contended with me;

14.text: What then shall I do when God rises up? When he visits, what shall I answer him?

15.text: Didn’t he who made me in the womb make him? Didn’t one fashion us in the womb?

16.text: “If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail,

17.text: or have eaten my morsel alone, and the fatherless has not eaten of it

18.text: (no, from my youth he grew up with me as with a father, her have I guided from my mother’s womb);

19.text: if I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or that the needy had no covering;

20.text: if his heart hasn’t blessed me, if he hasn’t been warmed with my sheep’s fleece;

21.text: if I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, because I saw my help in the gate,

22.text: then let my shoulder fall from the shoulder blade, and my arm be broken from the bone.

23.text: For calamity from God is a terror to me. Because his majesty, I can do nothing.

24.text: “If I have made gold my hope, and have said to the fine gold, ‘You are my confidence;’

25.text: If I have rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because my hand had gotten much;

26.text: if I have seen the sun when it shined, or the moon moving in splendor,

27.text: and my heart has been secretly enticed, and my hand threw a kiss from my mouth,

28.text: this also would be an iniquity to be punished by the judges; for I should have denied the God who is above.

29.text: “If I have rejoiced at the destruction of him who hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him;

30.text: (yes, I have not allowed my mouth to sin by asking his life with a curse);

31.text: if the men of my tent have not said, ‘Who can find one who has not been filled with his meat?’

32.text: (the foreigner has not lodged in the street, but I have opened my doors to the traveler);

33.text: if like Adam I have covered my transgressions, by hiding my iniquity in my heart,

34.text: because I feared the great multitude, and the contempt of families terrified me, so that I kept silence, and didn’t go out of the door—

35.text: oh that I had one to hear me! (behold, here is my signature, let the Almighty answer me); let the accuser write my indictment!

36.text: Surely I would carry it on my shoulder; and I would bind it to me as a crown.

37.text: I would declare to him the number of my steps. as a prince would I go near to him.

38.text: If my land cries out against me, and its furrows weep together;

39.text: if I have eaten its fruits without money, or have caused its owners to lose their life,

40.text: let briars grow instead of wheat, and stinkweed instead of barley.” The words of Job are ended.
